Normally going for $319 in full, we saw it drop to its $200 low for July’s short Prime Day period, with things since the middle of that month having kept costs at its full rate, with two drops to $280 in the time since. While this isn’t the lowest price, it is one of the rarer instances of a significant discount on Husqvarna equipment recently, with the 16% markdown here providing a solid $50 in savings while giving you a heavy-duty means to keep weeds and grass under control.

It would normally cost you $1,099 were you buying it at full price, which we’ve mainly seen dropped down to $999 and $899 rates over 2025, with some falls as low as $599 that only appeared once back in July. You’re looking at the next-best price while the $400 savings last here, giving you a much more affordable commuter that doubles on saving space when not in use.

While they were already a super affordable option when they debuted recently at $13, they have now dropped down to $9.99 with free shipping for primetime members or in orders over $35. items.title: Add LEGO’s soon-to-be-retired 2,103-piece Ideas Viking Village set with four minifigures at $104 (Reg. $130)
items.summary:
Over at Target, you can currently score the soon-to-be-retired LEGO Ideas Viking Village set for $103.69 shipped, which is not available at Amazon and keeps to its $130 MSRP direct from LEGO’s website. Since its release back in 2023, we’ve only seen a handful of discounts pop up in the last two years, mostly in 2024. While it has gone lower in the past, the 20% markdown still gives you a rare chance at $26 off the going rate, with LEGO also deeming it to be retired in the foreseeable future, so you won’t want to miss out while it’s still around at this price (with rates often jumping up at other marketplaces once sets are retired).
